item.title: Best Cinnamon Sugar Pumpkin Bread
item.description: Indulge in the warm, comforting flavors of this cinnamon sugar pumpkin bread. Perfectly moist and topped with a crunchy cinnamon sugar layer, it's an irresistible treat for any occasion. | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 45min | Serves: 1 | #cat1761230294638 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 45 minutes

â° Total Time: 60 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 1

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup pumpkin puree
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 1/2 cup vegetable oil
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 cup sugar for topping
  • 1 tablespoon cinnamon for topping

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and grease a loaf pan.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the pumpkin puree, sugar, and vegetable oil until well combined.
  3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
  4. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
  6. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.
  7. In a small bowl, mix together the sugar and cinnamon for the topping, then sprinkle it evenly over the batter.
  8. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
  9. Allow to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

item.title: No-Bake Pumpkin Delight
item.description: Experience the essence of autumn with this No-Bake Pumpkin Delight, a dessert that combines a crispy ginger snap crust with a smooth cream cheese layer and a luscious pumpkin filling. Topped with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon, it's a delightful tribute to fall that will leave you craving more. | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Serves: 9 | #cat1761230294638 #easyrecipe #quickrecipe #30minutemeals #recipe
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 0 minutes

â° Total Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 9

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 package ginger snap cookies, crushed
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
  • 8 ounces cream cheese, softened
  • 1 cup powdered sugar
  • 1 can (15 ounces) pumpkin puree
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1 cup heavy whipping cream
  • Additional cinnamon for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a bowl, mix crushed ginger snap cookies with melted butter until well combined.
  2. Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13 inch dish to form the crust.
  3. In another bowl, beat the cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth.
  4. Add the pumpkin puree, vanilla extract, and ground cinnamon to the cream cheese mixture and mix until well blended.
  5. Spread the pumpkin mixture over the crust evenly.
  6. In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form, then spread it over the pumpkin layer.
  7. Sprinkle additional cinnamon on top for garnish.
  8. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 25 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 40 minutes

â° Total Time: 65 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 6 ancho chili peppers, stemmed and seeded
  • 6 guajillo peppers, stemmed and seeded
  • 2 pasilla peppers, stemmed and seeded

  • 1 tablespoon Mexican oregano
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 small onion, chopped
  • 2 jalapeno peppers, chopped (optional)
  • 4-5 cloves garlic, chopped
  • 2.5 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into bite-sized chunks
  • Â¼ cup flour
  • 2 cups beef stock
  • Crumbly white cheese, fresh herbs, spicy chili flakes, lime juice for serving
  • Rice and/or warmed tortillas for serving

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Make the sauce first by dry toasting the dried peppers in a pan for about a minute per side, until the skins blister a bit. Set them into a bowl and cover with hot water for 20 minutes, until they are very soft.
  2. Transfer the peppers to a blender with oregano, cumin, a bit of salt and pepper, and 1 cup of the soaking water. Blend until nice and smooth. Strain the sauce and set aside.
  3. Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Toss the cubed chuck roast in the flour with a bit of salt and pepper to coat them. Brown the beef on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove to a plate and set aside.
  4. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the onion and peppers and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
  5. Add the red chili sauce and stock to the pot and bring to a boil. Add the browned meat back to the pot. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for at least 30 minutes to let the flavors develop. For melt-in-your-mouth tender beef, simmer for 2 hours or more.
  6. If youâ€™d like to thicken the chili, remove the cover and increase the heat. Cook until the moisture cooks out and your preferred thickness is achieved.

  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • Red and green food coloring

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.

  3. Beat in the egg, vanilla extract, and peppermint extract until well combined.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until a dough forms.

  7. Roll out small pieces of each color into long ropes, then twist them together to form a candy cane shape.
